      • MIN_HSIZE

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomGridBuilder

        public RandomGridBuilder()
        This creates a flat grid, with dimensions 10x10 and no obstacles. No lightGrenades or any other object. This is mainly used for testing purposes.

      • RandomGridBuilder

        public RandomGridBuilder(int hSize,
                 int vSize)
        Creates a new GridBuilder with parameters to create a new grid. This constructor will place random Walls, LightGrenades, identityDiscs and Teleports according to the constraints.
        Parameters:
        hSize - The horizontal size of the grid this gridBuilder will build.
        vSize - The vertical size of the grid this gridBuilder will build.

      • RandomGridBuilder

        protected RandomGridBuilder(int hSize,
                 int vSize,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate>> walls,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> lightGrenades,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> identityDisks,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> teleports,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> forceFieldGenerators,
                 Coordinate chargedIdentityDisk)
        Creates a new GridBuilder with parameters to create a new grid. Currently the given coordinates will be checked on the usual constraints! Keep this in mind when building test grids.
        Parameters:
        hSize - The horizontal size of the grid this gridBuilder will build.
        vSize - The vertical size of the grid this gridBuilder will build.
        walls - A list of sequences of coordinates where walls should be placed.
        lightGrenades - A list of coordinates that should contain a LightGrenade.
        identityDisks - A list of coordinates that should contain a identityDisk
        teleports - A list of coordinates that should contain a teleport.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidHSize

        public boolean isValidHSize(int hSize)
        Checks if the number of horizontal Squares is valid to create a grid with.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:
        hSize - the horizontal size of the grid.

        public boolean isValidVSize(int vSize)

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • build

        protected void build()
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Builds the actual grid.

      • build

        protected void build(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> lightGrenades,
         java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> identityDisks,
         java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> teleports,
         java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> fFgen,
         Coordinate chargedIdentityDisk)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Utility build method used for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        lightGrenades - The lightGrenades to set on the grid.
        identityDisks - The lightGrenades to set on the grid.
        teleports - The lightGrenades to set on the grid.
        fFgen - The lightGrenades to set on the grid.
        chargedIdentityDisk - the location of the chargedIdentityDisk
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getWall

        java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getWall(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> candidates,
                                      int maxWallLength)
        Returns a list of coordinates representing a wall.
        Parameters:
        candidates - A list of coordinates that are candidates for having a wall.
        maxWallLength - The maximum amount of squares a single wall can cover.
        Returns:
        A list of coordinates that now have a wall placed on it.

      • removePerimeter

        void removePerimeter(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> coordinates,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> candidates)
        Removes all squares around a wall of a list of candidates
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The coordinates of which the perimeter should be removed
        candidates - the list of squares of which the perimeter of the wall will be removed.

      • getCoordinatesOfWalls

        public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getCoordinatesOfWalls(java.util.ArrayList<Wall> walls)
        Returns the coordinates of the given walls on the grid of this GridBuilder.
        Parameters:
        walls - The walls of which the coordinates are wanted.
        Returns:
        The coordinates covered by the walls.
